revised_title: Franz Sondheimer: A Pioneering Organic Chemist
tldr: Franz Sondheimer was a renowned organic chemist known for his significant contributions to the fields of acetylenic compounds and annulenes. He worked at various institutions, including Imperial College, Harvard, Syntex, Weizmann Institute, University of Chicago, and University College London. Sondheimer's research focused on the synthesis of unsaturated fatty acids, steroid synthesis, and the chemistry of annulenes. He was a dedicated and inspiring mentor, and his work had a lasting impact on the field of organic chemistry.
